item.description:
So summers winding down and so is the Hamden outdoor film series. This year they saved the best for last and will be showing The Princess Bride this friday in the park at sundown.

Some may remember 'The Princess Bride' used to be a regular feature shown during the new haven movies on the green and was always a great time with many of the audience mouthing along dialogue...we'll see if the suburban crowd is as hip.

The Hamden Town Center Park is next to Miller memorial library, you can park in the library or on any of the side streets. Theres no seating so bring your blankets and lawn chairs. Pack a picnic or a cooler if you wish. The film starts at sundown (approx 7:30, so expect it to start around 8), we'll likely get there an hour or two before to get a spot.

Obviously this event is weather permitting so I'll update the day of the film along with details on where in the park we will be located.

My cell number is 203-499-7777

http://www.hamden.com/filestorage/7089/7093/7091/7117/FREE_Movie_Nights_at_Town_Center_Park3.pdf

Â 

:)
item.name: THE PRINCESS BRIDE-Free Outdoor Movie in the Park
